content: pumpkin you can vary this part as you like for different effects secure end weave it in i- cord stem - using stem color brown cast 5 stitches onto one dpn and make an i-cord about 1 5 inches long or length desired bind off and sew onto top of pumpkin instructions can be found at knittinghelp com leaf - leaf is done flat and i used the us 5 dpns i used backward loop for increases 1 co 2 2 k2 co 1 using backward loop 3 k3 co 1 4 k4 co 1 5 k5 co 1 6 k6 across 7 k6 co 2 8 k8 co 2 9 k10 across 10 k10 across 11 k2tog k6 k2tog 12 k2tog k4 k2tog 13 k2 k2tog k2 14 k2tog k1 k2tog do not turn 15 make appx ½ inch i-cord for leaf stem 16 end with a k3tog 17 attach to pumpkin at base of stem that s it notes pumpkins are often wonky shaped so it s okay and even preferable if the stuffing isn t perfectly round i added a curl like those found on pumpkins by crocheting a chain appx 3 in and then starting second chain from hook doing 2 single crochets in each chain attach to pumpkin near leaf you can also create the curl right on the end of the leaf stem before attaching it saving one step of sewing to make a larger pumpkin increase to 5 stitches in each rib and then knit 5 p1 in center segment to make it taller decrease one extra time on top copyright- this is my design and you may use it for personal use gifts and charity if you wish to use for any other purpose or have a comment or suggestion please email me at purrcat1@gmail com thank you i hope you enjoy making it as much as i did ☺ jan lewis
